revised_title: The 1751 Eruption of Mount Vesuvius: Observations and Impacts
tldr: This article describes the 1751 eruption of Mount Vesuvius, detailing the initial earthquake, the discovery of the lava's source, and the advancement of the lava flows. The author, Richard Supple, also discusses the potential impacts of the eruption, including the possible change in the course of the river Sarno and the historical comparison to the eruption in the reign of Titus Vespasian.
